name: Elios Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for a couple of unplanned nights having been stranded in Ho Chi Minh because of the Icelandic Volcano. We had a perfectly good room with two single beds and a double bed. It was on the 9th floor and had some of the best views we had seen as we overlooked a park.
reviews.title: A fine city hotel

reviews.text: The hotel completely suited our purpose being clean, helpful staff and a good location near to the back packer district.
reviews.title: Clean, efficient, no-nonsense

reviews.text: For a couple of nights in this very busy city it was just fine.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a busy district

reviews.text: The rooms are spotless with basic amenities. I chose the hotel for the free wi-fi in the rooms. My room had no windows, but it's a plus when it comes to a quiet night of sleep, since the hotel is in a busy area of town. As a solo female traveler, I felt safe and relaxed in the room.
reviews.title: Budget Hotel in an iffy location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first night was very quiet, the second night the upstairs people walked around in either heavy clogs or high heels, dragging their luggage across the room, so it was a bit noisy. Called the hotel and asked them to take care of that - and things quieted down.
reviews.title: Clean, nice hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value for money. We were paying USD30 a night and it was a great base for our stay in HCM. We walked everywhere, following the Lonely Planet walking guide. It is in the backpacker area, however there is lots nearby. The bell boys were wonderful in helping us with taxis and advice. Breakfast was very nice and had a great view of the city.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was small and simple, yet very clean and had everything we needed - satellite tv, a bath and nice bed.
reviews.title: Outstanding assistance during an unfortunate incident. Greatly appreciated their support!

reviews.text: Great place to stay for value for money!
reviews.title: Good location, shame about the cockroach!

reviews.text: My husband and I started and finished our stay in Vietnam at the Elios Hotel in Saigon. Initially we found the location perfect, very close to the Ben Thanh Markets and great restaurants and nightlife. Because of the location and the value for money we booked to come back on our departure.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been so impressed with all of the accommodation throughout Vietnam, but it wasn't until we really required help that this gem of a hotel stood out above all others. It was our last night in Vietnam and our backpack with our camera was stolen. All of our precious memories of Vietnam gone, without a backup! The wonderful husband and wife owners and all the staff went out of their way to assist us in this upsetting situation. Of special mention was the bell boy Duc, who asked everyone in the area that our camera was stolen if they knew anything. He took us to the police station and translated our problem to the police so that we could get a report for insurance. The police would provide no help at all. The owners had another bell boy take us to the police station the next day in case another shift would be more helpful, but the police were still uninterested. The hotel then wrote us a very detailed letter for our insurance policy, which was greatly appreciated.
reviews.title: Good value in reasonable location

reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights at the Elios. Our 4th trip to Vietnam first stay at this hotel. Paid approx $54 US a night for a superior room. Very modern,comfortable beds, aircon, tv, mini bar etc. In the backpacking district very busy, however after visiting for 9 years Ho Chi Minh is very busy everywhere. No problem with hotel, would recommend highly. Would advise caution on the streets, I wore my gold chains inadvertantly and a motorbike rider came up behind me and grabbed for my necklaces, i was quick enough to keep hold of them, however they were broken and i had a nasty scratch on my neck, locals were horrified and all came to help me....it was very frightening and I was grateful they didn't knock me down with the force or get my shoulder bag. Restaurant on the roof has fabulous views and for a free breakfast I was very happy with the selection.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great price, handy position, superb staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were recommended by our taxi driver, so we booked this hotel upon our arrival in HCM City and planned to stay here for just 1 night, then looked for another hotel next day. We changed our mind in the next morning and booked for 2 more nights because our room was very clean and we could sleep very well, moreover their buffet breakfast was so good and we liked it very much. The staff was very friendly and informative.
reviews.title: Nice location, Good breakfast & Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Little Gem - if you don't want to spend too much this is a great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paul
reviews.title: We must have been unlucky...

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed in the Elios on two separate occasions as we travelled around Vietnam and Cambodia, and we were very happy with our choice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Not so good......
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in March2010 for 1 night as I had a stopover in HCMC. Booked a room well in advance for this hotel and found out at check-in that they only offered queen bed, tried upgrading to a superior room with twin beds but this was not possible. I ended up in a room without any windows (no daylight!) , and it was quite smelly and damp due to the lack of a window. Instead, they had a fan blowing in some air 24/7. They hallway is noisy and there was noise of a nearby construction site. Breakfast is poor and does not offer a lot of choice.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location and really friendly staff
reviews.text: Good location close to the park. Staff very helpful and attentive. Room was very clean with a good view of the park. The furnishings were good throughout with a really comfortable bed decent bathroom

reviews.title: Great Value for money!!!
reviews.text: Breakfast was also excellent with a good choice of western & local dishes.

reviews.title: Homy accomodation in superb location
reviews.text: Overall a good value hotel in an excellent location.

reviews.title: great location, great service,very clean friendly hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and found the hotel very clean, the staff helpful, the internet worked well, the rooms were a bit small but we did have a small window and the bathroom was roomy. The breakfast was very good by Vietnamese breakfast standards.

description: Elios Hotel is an international 3-star hotel, enjoys its location in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, within working distance of fabulous shopping as well as the city’s business and entertainment districts. We boast of eye-catching, spectacular park view and all 80 cozy rooms are elegant and modern designed with your utmost comfort in mind. Elios Hotel, a home away from home, will offer a pleasant stay with all your needs is satisfied.
